visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing comparative wheat export values across countries using categorical data labeling with currency-formatted annotations
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two dimensions: categorical country names (nominal scale) and quantitative export values in billion USD (ratio scale). Data quality appears high as values follow real-world rankings with Russia and US leading, though synthetic decimal precision suggests estimated figures. Original source citation enhances credibility. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and legend while maintaining clear value labels. Vertical orientation leverages position-along-common-scale perception for magnitude comparison. Color saturation (#5997DE) creates figure-ground contrast against white background. Data labels with 'BUS$' units provide immediate quantitative reference without legend dependency. Y-axis tick interval (2B) matches data range (1-6.4B) for optimal density. Tooltip formatting maintains consistency with axis labels through standardized currency units.
